class notdiamond.toolkit.rag.evaluation_dataset.RAGEvaluationDataset(samples: t.List[Sample])[source]

Bases: RagasDataset[RAGSample]

Represents a dataset of RAG evaluation samples.

Parameters:

samples (List[Sample])

samples

A list of evaluation samples.

Type:

List[BaseSample]

validate_samples(samples)

Validates that all samples are of the same type.

get_sample_type()

Returns the type of the samples in the dataset.

to_hf_dataset()

Converts the dataset to a Hugging Face Dataset.

to_pandas()

Converts the dataset to a pandas DataFrame.

features()

Returns the features of the samples.

Create a new model by parsing and validating input data from keyword arguments.

Raises [ValidationError][pydantic_core.ValidationError] if the input data cannot be validated to form a valid model.

self is explicitly positional-only to allow self as a field name.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

notdiamond.toolkit.rag.evaluation.get_eval_dataset(test_queries: DataFrame, workflow: BaseNDRagWorkflow, generation_prompt: str | None = None, generator_llm: LLMConfig | str | None = None)[source]

Create a dataset of RAGSample objects to evaluate the performance of a RAG workflow.

Parameters:

  • test_queries (DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame with schema implied by the method below.

  • workflow (BaseNDRagWorkflow) – BaseNDRagWorkflow subclass created by the user.

  • generation_prompt (str | None)

  • generator_llm (LLMConfig | str | None)

Schema for test_queries can be found below https://docs.ragas.io/en/stable/references/evaluation_schema/#ragas.dataset_schema.SingleTurnSample

notdiamond.toolkit.rag.testset

class notdiamond.toolkit.rag.testset.TestDataGenerator(llm: ~ragas.llms.base.BaseRagasLLM, embedding_model: ~ragas.embeddings.base.BaseRagasEmbeddings, knowledge_graph: ~ragas.testset.graph.KnowledgeGraph = KnowledgeGraph(nodes: 0, relationships: 0), persona_list: ~typing.List[~ragas.testset.persona.Persona] | None = None)[source]

Bases: TestsetGenerator

RAG Test data generator class. Generates test cases from documents for evaluating RAG workflows.

Parameters:

  • llm (BaseRagasLLM) – An LLM object inherited from BaseRagasLLM. Obtain this via the get_llm tool.

  • embedding_model (BaseRagasEmbeddings) – An embedding model object inherited from BaseRagasEmbeddings. Obtain this via the get_embedding tool.

  • knowledge_graph (KnowledgeGraph) – The knowledge graph to use for the generation process. Default empty.

  • persona_list (List[Persona] | None)

generate_from_docs(documents: Sequence[Document] | Sequence[Document], testset_size: int, transforms: List[BaseGraphTransformation] | Parallel | BaseGraphTransformation | None = None, transforms_llm: BaseRagasLLM | BaseLLM | None = None, transforms_embedding_model: BaseRagasEmbeddings | BaseEmbedding | None = None, query_distribution: List[Tuple[BaseSynthesizer, float]] | None = None, run_config: RunConfig | None = None, callbacks: List[BaseCallbackHandler] | BaseCallbackManager | None = None, with_debugging_logs: bool = False, raise_exceptions: bool = True) → DataFrame[source]

Generates an evaluation dataset based on given Langchain or Llama Index documents and parameters.

Parameters:

  • documents (Sequence[Document] | Sequence[Document]) – Sequence[LCDocument] A sequence of Langchain documents to use as source material

  • testset_size (int) – int The number of test samples to generate

  • transforms (List[BaseGraphTransformation] | Parallel | BaseGraphTransformation | None) – Optional[Transforms], optional Custom transforms to apply to the documents, by default None

  • transforms_llm (BaseRagasLLM | BaseLLM | None) – Optional[BaseRagasLLM], optional LLM to use for transforms if different from instance LLM, by default None

  • transforms_embedding_model (BaseRagasEmbeddings | BaseEmbedding | None) – Optional[BaseRagasEmbeddings], optional Embedding model to use for transforms if different from instance model, by default None

  • query_distribution (List[Tuple[BaseSynthesizer, float]] | None) – Optional[QueryDistribution], optional Distribution of query types to generate, by default None

  • run_config (RunConfig | None) – Optional[RunConfig], optional Configuration for the generation run, by default None

  • callbacks (List[BaseCallbackHandler] | BaseCallbackManager | None) – Optional[Callbacks], optional Callbacks to use during generation, by default None

  • with_debugging_logs (bool) – bool, optional Whether to include debug logs, by default False

  • raise_exceptions (bool) – bool, optional Whether to raise exceptions during generation, by default True

Returns:

Testset

The generated evaluation dataset

Raises:

ValueError – If no LLM or embedding model is provided either during initialization or as arguments

Return type:

DataFrame

notdiamond.toolkit.rag.workflow

class notdiamond.toolkit.rag.workflow.BaseNDRagWorkflow(documents: Any, test_queries: Any | None = None, objective_maximize: bool = True, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

A base interface for a RAG workflow to be auto-evaluated by Not Diamond.

Subclasses should define parameter_specs to type parameters they need to optimize, by using type annotations with the above dataclasses. For example:

class ExampleNDRagWorkflow(BaseNDRagWorkflow):
    parameter_specs = {
        "chunk_size": (Annotated[int, IntValueRange(1000, 2500, 500)], 1000),
                        "chunk_overlap": (Annotated[int, IntValueRange(50, 200, 25)], 100),
                        "top_k": (Annotated[int, IntValueRange(1, 20, 1)], 5),
                        "algo": (
                                Annotated[
                                        str,
                                        CategoricalValueOptions(
                                                [
                                                        "BM25",
                                                        "openai_small",
                                                        "openai_large",
                                                        "cohere_eng",
                                                        "cohere_multi",
                                                ]
                ),
            ],
            "BM25",
        ),
        "temperature": (Annotated[float, FloatValueRange(0.0, 1.0, 0.1)], 0.9),
    }
Parameters:

  • evaluation_dataset – A dataset of RAG evaluation samples.

  • documents (Any) – The documents to use for RAG.

  • objective_maximize (bool) – Whether to maximize or minimize the objective defined below.

  • test_queries (Any | None)

__init__(documents: Any, test_queries: Any | None = None, objective_maximize: bool = True, **kwargs)[source]
Parameters:

  • evaluation_dataset – A dataset of RAG evaluation samples.

  • documents (Any) – The documents to use for RAG.

  • objective_maximize (bool) – Whether to maximize or minimize the objective defined below.

  • test_queries (Any | None)

job_name()[source]
objective()[source]

Define the objective function for your RAG workflow. The workflow’s hyperparameters will be optimized according to values of this objective.

rag_workflow(documents: Any, test_queries: List[str] | None) → RAGEvaluationDataset[source]

Define RAG workflow components here by setting instance attrs on self. Those attributes will be set at init-time and available when retrieving context or generating responses.

Parameters:

  • documents (Any)

  • test_queries (List[str] | None)

Return type:

RAGEvaluationDataset
